definition: To spread out; to scatter or send in different directions.
usage: I threw a handful of leaves up and the wind dispersed them in all different directions.

images.alt: Photo of dandelion and drifting seeds.
images.description: A cluster of tiny, white, fluffy objects on the top of a plant stem. Some of the tiny white fluffy objects have separated from the plant and are floating away.
images.caption: Dandelion seeds disperse in the wind.

definition: Separation based on a certain quality, especially race.
usage: When segregation was legal, black and white children were forced to go to different schools.

images.alt: Photo of a child at outdoor water fountain.
images.description: A child stands at an outdoor drinking water fountain. A sign on a tree next to the fountain reads, “COLORED.
images.caption: Segregation, such as having different water fountains for people of different colors, is no longer legal in the U.S.

usage: The school reforms made learning easier and better for everyone.
“Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.”--Martin Luther King, Jr.

definition: To support or protect something, especially when others are fighting or arguing against it.
usage: The cat used its claws to defend itself when the dog tried to bit it.

images.alt: Photo of small tiles, with hand between fallen and standing tiles.
images.description: A row of small tiles, called dominos, extends from the lower right of the photo to the upper left. A person’s hand is in the middle, between tiles. Tiles in front of the hand have fallen toward the hand. Tiles behind the hand remain standing.
images.caption: The hand is a defense that protects the standing dominos from being knocked over.
